C D E F G I N O P R S T

C

Cached<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A Cached object is a specialized Deferred that holds a reference to (ie: caches) an object that was successfully returned by another Deferred.
Cached(Deferred<T>) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Cached
Constructs a Cached for the specified Deferred.
cached(Deferred<T>) - Static method in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.DeferredHelper
Obtains an Cached of the specified Deferred.

D

DEFAULT_RETRY_DURATION_MS - Static variable in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Ensured
The number of milliseconds to wait between attempting to acquire the object from the specified Deferred.
DEFAULT_TOTAL_RETRY_DURATION_SECS - Static variable in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Ensured
The total number of seconds to retry acquiring the object from the specified Deferred before giving up.
DEFAULT_TOTAL_RETRY_DURATION_SECS - Static variable in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Notified
The total number of seconds to wait to be notified before giving up.
Deferred<T> - Interface in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A Deferred object represents a reference some well-known object, that of which may yet not be available.

DeferredInvoke<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred

DeferredJMXConnector.JMXConnectorBuilder - Interface in com.oracle.tools.deferred.jmx
A DeferredJMXConnector.JMXConnectorBuilder provides a mechanism to realize a JMXConnector when required.
DeferredJMXConnector.StandardJMXConnectorBuilder - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred.jmx
A DeferredJMXConnector.StandardJMXConnectorBuilder is a DeferredJMXConnector.JMXConnectorBuilder implementation that uses standard JMX methods to create a JMXConnector.

Ensured<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
An Ensured is a specialized Deferred implementation that does it's best to guarantee a non-null reference will be returned when a call to Ensured.get() is made.
Ensured(Deferred<T>) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Ensured
Construct an Ensured adapting the specified Deferred.

Obtains a Deferred representation of the last call to a dynamic proxy created with either DeferredHelper.invoking(Object) or DeferredHelper.invoking(Deferred).
eventually(Deferred<T>) - Static method in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.DeferredHelper

Existing<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A Existing is a specialized Deferred implementation that is based on a well-known and already established object, that is guaranteed to be available when Existing.get() is called.
Existing(T) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Existing
Construct a Existing given a specified object.

N

NeverAvailable<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A NeverAvailable is a specialized Deferred that always throws an ObjectNotAvailableException when attempting to call NeverAvailable.get().
NeverAvailable(Class<T>) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.NeverAvailable
Constructor for a NeverAvailable reference.
NotAvailable<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A NotAvailable is a specialized Deferred that always returns null when attempting to call NotAvailable.get().
NotAvailable(Class<T>) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.NotAvailable
Constructor for a NotAvailable reference.
notified(T) - Static method in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.DeferredHelper
Obtains a Notified for the specified object.
notified(T, long, TimeUnit) - Static method in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.DeferredHelper
Obtains a Notified for the specified object.
Notified<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A Notified is a Deferred that represents a synchronized object that should be Object.notify()ed, including with Object.notifyAll(), before it can be used.
Notified(T) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Notified
Construct an Ensured adapting the specified Deferred.
Notified(T, long, TimeUnit) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Notified
Constructs a Notified.

O

ObjectNotAvailableException - Exception in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A ObjectNotAvailableException is thrown by a Deferred when an attempt to acquire an underlying object fails due to it not being available and for intensive purposes, will never become available, regardless of the number of retries.
ObjectNotAvailableException(Deferred<?>) - Constructor for exception com.oracle.tools.deferred.ObjectNotAvailableException
Constructs a ObjectNotAvailableException for the specified Deferred.
ObjectNotAvailableException(Deferred<?>, Throwable) - Constructor for exception com.oracle.tools.deferred.ObjectNotAvailableException
Constructs a ObjectNotAvailableException for the specified Deferred, with the specified causing Throwable.

resourceNoLongerAvailable() - Method in class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Supervised
Applications should call this method when they determine, through some external means, that the underlying object they have acquired from the Supervised is no longer available.

Starts the StopWatch.
stop() - Method in class com.oracle.tools.util.StopWatch
Stops the StopWatch so that the duration can be measured.
StopWatch - Class in com.oracle.tools.util
A simple class that provides the functionality of a stop watch with millisecond accuracy (though this is based on the level of accuracy provided by the underlying operating system).
StopWatch() - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.util.StopWatch
Constructs a StopWatch (in the not started state)
Supervised<T> - Class in com.oracle.tools.deferred
A Supervised is a Deferred adapter that has knowledge of the last known availability of an object, the purpose of which is to ensure that the underlying object is protected from repeated and perhaps continuously unrelenting requests by an application to access it, when it simply may be unavailable for a long period of time.
Supervised(Deferred<T>) - Constructor for class com.oracle.tools.deferred.Supervised
Constructor for a Supervised.
